Pre-Game Insights: India have won all seven completed T20Is against Ireland so far
India played two high-profile games at the last T20 World Cup and won the one where the pitch was tough to bat on
Discipline more than strength seems to be the necessary ingredient to win at this T20 World Cup
Jasprit Bumrah will hold his length back and prioritize being unhittable first
Paul Stirling will respond with calculated risks to maximize the powerplay
Kuldeep Yadav will make the most of his improved air speed by never giving up the stumps
Ireland live for games like these, for occasions like these
Miscellaneous Highlights: Putting just the jersey back on gave him goosebumps. Imagine how it would feel when Rishabh Pant walks out there to bat
Harry Tector made his highest T20I score against India, an action-packed 64 off 33 balls
The middle-order batter stands out for both his power and his temperament and this T20 World Cup might just be his time
India's bowling contains plenty of variety but it is centered around Bumrah and Kuldeep, players with the kind of talent that can dominate whole tournaments
Ireland's batting goes down to No. 8 and it has a reasonable split between power-hitters and shock absorbers
Andy Balbirnie and Lorcan Tucker have the ability to do both of those roles
Their bowling is seam-dominated but left-arm spinner George Dockrell could get an over or two against the more orthodox batters in the Indian line-up
Others: The weather in New York is perfect for cricket. Not too hot, not too cold, no worry about dew
The pitch and outfield, however, will be under the scanner again after the events from Monday, where 80 for 4 in 16.2 overs played 77 all out
But things can only get better. India played a warm-up game here, on a different track, and they scored 180
